6IdwVukuA1J8INX4iMr6gg.text: Just tried The Crack'd Egg diner this morning for breakfast and it's easily a new favorite. The place has a very cute set up and is extremely clean! They have a huge menu with so many options of not only breakfast items but lunch items as well. I've been to other breakfast places that are so busy and filled up it's a little intimidating! It wasn't all that busy today, but they of course have a good turn out for a newer diner! The price is very reasonable and the food is very fresh! This is a great add to Brownsville road! Very convenient location!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Nutella french toast!
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. The Eastwood omelet with potato pancakes!

DTqrkmfSkeOlRLs_PuG4QQ.text: I love this place!! I just don't like that there is no privacy in the bathrooms. When I was 6 months pregnant I was in the bathroom puking, and everyone in the restaurant heard! How embarrassing, but I laugh about it now!

7UJRX0ZThpXNacmoaPzNsw.text: Cute little place, very family friendly. They gave my niece a balloon after she was done eating! And they had toys and games for kids to borrow while there. They have a tiny patio where I saw a couple of dogs. Food was good, not great. Everyone seemed okay with their meals. My sister in law got biscuits and gravy we were shocked at the small portions. We got a bacon basket, which was awesome. We had to ask for coffee refills, but they were busy. Decent place for breakfast in the area!

mk_ZMm7xz7tVAKPNGTwVvQ.text: Great food overall and staff friendly and attentive.  My wife's eggs Benedict was the only complaint as the poached eggs were both cooked hard which is not how they should be. Portions are huge and prices are a bit high, but the food quality is quite good. Very busy on weekends but the weekdays are a great day to go in and have breakfast or brunch.

N89r6n5XwGQJf3XbKcNb1w.text: My girlfriend and I have gone here a few times and it has become our favorite breakfast/brunch spot in Pittsburgh.  The prices are very reasonable, especially considering the service and quality of food you receive. When it's nice out you can sit outside, or sit inside and enjoy the sunlight as they open the garage door at the front of the restaurant.  This place is BYOB and also have a BYOB Bloody Mary Bar on Sundays (this is something you never find)!  I have ordered a different item off the menu all three visits and I would re-order and recommend all three (corned beef hash, breakfast burrito, chicken and eggs).  I cannot wait to go again on Sunday!

W_9POGKFZaEmuIXPzRuwRg.text: We want to like this place, we really do. It's within walking distance from our house and has been nicely updated. Not to mention it's a small business. I'd much rather support and contribute my money to places like this than a chain.   That being said, today was our third time here since they opened. We waited for an unusually long period of time, given the availability of tables and staff, which has been par for the course here.   It took about 15 minutes to be seated, 20 minutes for my daughter's waffles to come out and ANOTHER 25 MINUTES for our other three entrees. Both my other daughter and fiancee had hot dogs which were both overcooked. My daughter's hot dog was supposed to be bacon wrapped. It wasn't. To remedy, they brought a side of crispy bacon 10 minutes later.   While I felt bad for the server being caught in the crossfire, every time she came over and our food wasn't out yet, we got a dirty look. Later, when apologizing for the wait, she called the cook out by name. While I agree, most of this was the kitchen's fault, that was pretty unprofessional. Other tables that came in after us got their food first and not a SINGLE table had their food brought out together. It was a mess.   The manager came over and ended up asking my advice and who's fault I thought it was after divulging that I worked for years as a server. A little unnerving and again, unprofessional.   We ended up with a discount and a lot of dessert they comped us to go, but it was too little, too late, for us.   We got the feeling there was a lot of inner conflict and nepotism going on here which is a perfect example of why business and family should never mix.

ZM5sMxf1vV4r6BbofmFhTw.text: Love this place ... Service is great waiters are friendly environment is nice and clean cute upscale place....

jvzVI2jaWa-GOc_z5hcY2w.text: I only review the places that you MUST visit or purchase services and the ones to steer clear of, this is a hidden gem in Brentwood. Have been there several times for breakfast, never an extended wait, servers are super friendly, food is fresh, eggs NOT cooked in a vat of grease (thank you), French toast is devine, and although their iced coffee comes from a concentrate, I fell in love with it. This is one of the cleanest restaurants I've ever been. My only complaint is that they don't do a bigger dinner menu, I'd love to see them do Farm to Table entrees with substance.

c-C72a9FMPPJDaUWGR8RVA.text: I'm not very picky when it comes to service- but this was probably one of the worst experiences I've ever had. The wait was over 45 minutes, and when we finally got seated it was at an awkward table that was too small for our party. The waitress was horrible, she messed up the order and never came to refill any drinks. When she did come, it was to give us the bill and quickly ask us how the food tasted and literally started running away before we could answer. The food was below average and a bit soggy. It's sad because I'd like to support my local businesses, but I can't say I'll be going back.

A3rMi-rP_21gwdvhSl1kjg.text: This is about my fourth time coming here, and the food seems to only get better.  They have refined their eggs Benedict recipe, The Cracked Arnold, to where it is a bout the best I've ever tasted.  Of course the corn beef hash is great too.  Its hard to go wrong with almost anything on their menu.  On weekends it gets a little crowded as all restaurants do, so if you want no wait and faster than usual service, stop in during the week.  Still for how crowded it is the weekend service is still pretty good, and the food more than makes up for it.

4XYed8CL8GjatP79NFE_-g.text: Went here on Wednesday and was pleased. Only had breakfast and will come back for lunch/dinner. Food was great and service was great.   A little advice if the owners see this, don't yell that orders are ready from the kitchen. Just buy a bell and ding it when orders are up.

HRfCJy45jGYIxdTGjSK1lA.text: Let me begin by saying I don't tend to like diner's.  This is different the place is clean and the staff is so friendly.  My breakfast was amazing.  Best home fries I have had in a long time.  My food was so delicious.  I only wish I had more home fries

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Amazing home fries were amazing

ReqQerPzr1asZf9csvO77w.text: My husband and I stopped here for a late breakfast on Saturday.  The restaurant wasn't crowded and we were seated promptly.  Our server, Danielle, greeted us immediately and took good care of us while we were there.  I can't complain about the service at all.  I got the lemon ricotta pancakes with blueberry syrup.  I tasted neither lemon nor ricotta in the pancakes and the blueberry syrup tasted bitter and burnt...maybe it's just my tastebuds.  My husband ordered the 'Release the Crack'n' which was a little bit of everything - pancakes, eggs, potatoes, toast and bacon.  He thought his meal was quite good.  I was slightly put off by the music though.  The music playing in the restaurant was loud and very, very Christian.  Perhaps this doesn't bother most, but it was off-putting to us.  I don't mind a little background music while I eat, but I never like it loud enough to notice.  This was our first time so I'm not sure if this is an all the time thing or just the choice of a specific person this particular day.  Our meals with coffee were around $30, which was a little steep but we received plenty of food and were full all day.

578VGMy39JOTO7GVMkNJGw.text: We've been there three times. The first time we had a big group with lots of kids. They put us in the back out of the way and it worked out really well. The food was decent but with all the kids I didn't pay a lot of attention.   The other two times we only had one kid and the food was really bad. The hamburger was prepackaged and WAY over cooked. I got steak and eggs and the steak was so salty i could only take two bites and my mouth was on fire. It took me the entire day to get the salt taste out of my mouth. Really, I don't mind salt, but this was insane.   My wife got eggs Benedict type thing and the eggs were way over cooked. It was supposed to come with sliced mozzarella but they left it out.   Regretfully after those two experiences we won't be back.

NwnByLdc0U4lbWoMovBAtg.text: This is one of my favorite places. The atmosphere is friendly, the service is outstanding, food is great and coffee is awesome. If you have not dined here yet shame on you.

0i_ZGYI8b5bRAXpclSb4lg.text: The Bird and I have been to the Crack'D Egg nearly a dozen times already.  Don't let the name fool you this is not just a breakfast place.  From burgers to huge salads to the incredible meatloaf you will not be disappointed !  (Yes the breakfast items are great and fun!). The fact it is also a BYOB place just adds to the place!  We can't wait for the spring when they will open up the front garage door and we can sit outside and enjoy a glass of wine.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Participating in Brentwoods Light Up Night festivities !

QYZJFOWoRYChJDxOVTdZQA.text: I thought this place was great, very reasonable prices and extremely friendly staff. I came here around lunchtime on a weekday, and was able to be seated right away, which is nice. They have an open front to their restaurant, with a garage-door-style opening that can roll up or down in inclement weather. The decor inside was extremely charming, and spotlessly clean. I ordered the cracked egg sandwich with bacon, and loved it! I would probably recommend asking for provolone or mozzarella cheese in place of the American cheese, but that's just a personal preference. Will definitely go again.

jiZ1RXIXhfLthUVonHfWYQ.text: Grand Opening today at this establishment. We knew it was coming so we were excited to try out a place we had heard was going to be good. The restaurant feels like you are stepping into a friend or relatives eat in kitchen to have a meal. The staff is very friendly. They are knowledgeable about their menu. There is a "breakfast bar " type counter where you can sit or their is a large dining room. Everything is new, fresh, and clean. Its contemporary yet home-y.  I ordered the waffles. They come with 2 eggs and a breakfast meat. I gave my son the eggs. I ordered bacon as my meat. The waffles were crispy on the edges which is how I like them. The bacon was a little crispy and the saltiness wasn't overwhelming. The sweet of the waffles with the saltiness of the bacon was a great bite.  My son ordered blueberry pancakes. He chose bacon as his breakfast meat. The pancakes were full of blueberries. They were fantastic.  I think we just found a new breakfast place. They also serve lunch and dinner. I will definitely be coming back to try more dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Waffles
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Blueberry Pancakes
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

jqQRscjy5Y0nCVP8WSPUjQ.text: The food is good but the service can be a little slow.  I really enjoy the lemon ricotta pancakes if you can catch them on the menu when you go.  Great casual and inexpensive option for breakfast.

z2E1o9AuYnlvhNsT-Hpj-A.text: We really enjoyed our breakfast there.  The kids loved it too.  Very friendly service and good food.  I'm not a huge fan of french toast but theirs was very good.

umCLmxeVetAwkCRDpZV4jw.text: Great food. Great coffee. Servers, all of them, were there for anything we needed. Everything came out hot. Kids food first. All three kids were even given a balloon when we were done.  Small family friendly environment. Well worth any wait.

WouT5GfVnZLpiDao7_OXzA.text: My husband and I visited The Crack'd Egg this morning for breakfast. The restaurant's atmosphere was warm, welcoming, and cozy! I loved the decor and the environment. The waiter was on point and super friendly. Additionally, the food was excellent and we enjoyed every bite! ~ A great small business to support that provides a great experience!

M1wFwwPK_JC40aMCSadIyw.text: The food was good however, we felt that it was on the expensive side. Two omelets, two cups of coffee and a 20% tip came too $33.00. They charged $1.99 for a small portion of applesauce that went with the potato pancakes. Most restaurants do not charge for that.

zgsihBnseQNBXeiNB-0aLg.text: Overall Impression: A well-themed BYOB breakfast joint in Brentwood that has twists on breakfast classics, is moderately priced, and uses quality ingredients. The orange cloth napkins are just a bonus!  The Food: I don't know what more you could ask for--because they allow you to BYOB for Bloody Mary's and Mimosa's and have literal BUCKETS of bacon. Those two factors alone should make you want to high-tail it in there. My boyfriend and I frequent this place on weekends for breakfast, as he lives right down the road, and we've never been disappointed. I'm a chicken and gravy fan, so I usually order the "Chicken and the Egg" with my eggs over-easy with mini potato pancakes. The fried chicken tenders are decent although you may want to order extra gravy, it's a little skimpy for True gravy fans. The eggs are cooked exactly how you want them and the mini potato pancakes are perfectly seasoned. The boyfriend usually goes for the Eastwood omelet and adds ghost pepper cheese for an extra kick, and the eggs are fluffy and generously-filled. There is always ample toast and coffee creamer. The menu allows you to BYO-omelet, has a wide variety of choice, and even names a local sandwich, "The Brentwood Duke," as unique to the local area. There is little left to be desired with so much quality and variety attached--not to mention there's eggs on almost all breakfast dishes in a multitude of ways.  The Restaurant: I can only describe it as a quaint modern diner with an upscale twist. They use bright orange, green, and splashes of red to give a positive, fresh feeling, and they try keep a spacey feel to a rather cramped space. The ladies at the seating area are always pleasant, and you can choose to sit at the bar or within the restaurant--we prefer to sit at the bar, as there's more space to eat. The only aspect of this location that is borderline obnoxious is how small the tables are combined with how much stuff they try to stick on them (advertising, eating accoutrements, trash bucket, etc.), but I understand that they wanted to fit as many tables/booths as they could to their small space--maybe just nix the extra bits on the table? Between both of our breakfast plates and another plate in the middle of a shared waffle, we were accidentally pushing each other's plates halfway off the table and had to put all the extra things on the floor. Beside the small table space, they make up for it with their high emphasis on service. Their waiters are always very attentive and quick to clear unneeded tableware/refill coffee and water. It does get a little pricey if you start to BYOB because they do charge a cork fee. We've easily paid $50 with tip for breakfast between the two of us, which is a little much to me, but the quality backs the price.  TL;DR: The best breakfast place in Brentwood area for sure, and definitely good enough to be within the top 10 for Pittsburgh. The next time you want a breakfast date, go here. You'll love it.

yoOJDAUysmp1zsEmhEaC9Q.text: Went here for the 1st time this morning. Breakfast was really good. Omelette your way especially. Would definitely go back!!

JHSNfLZgTj_tPSO8bPF3Vw.text: I absolutely love this place.   Clean nicely decorated.  Service was excellent.  Waitress was very attentive. Took a little while for our order but nothing crazy.    Food was well worth the wait.  Good portion size.  More than I usually pay for breakfast but was worth every penny!

E-RKX-qRDf980B_9R1KGeA.text: I'm a breakfast lover and this spot definitely hit the spot. Ordered release the cracking and it did not disappoint, pancakes were so large and fluffy. Prices were perfect for the amount of food you receive. Definitely keeping on my list of top places to go to!

fla0dkWVwuojkrLLdmRxJg.text: Love this place. Home style feeling. Food is great and their pecan banana French toast are to die for. Sadly they only open till 3pm haha

pp9KdvB6RBF4PvldO6zRrg.text: This was not my first visit to this quaint place in Brentwood.  Loved that we could sit outside, such a nice morning!  Not very thrilled with my omelet this time, the eggs were tough, not sure how that happened.  And I got a side of potato pancakes, only got 3, one was hard as a rock.  My toast wasn't really toasted either.  I'll be back and hope this was just one bad meal for them.

6InUkcvB8-cRuniJSN5StQ.text: Really enjoyed our time here. Friendly service and good food. Prices are a little high but, overall it was great!

zDU0NibczW5L05qD92o2rw.text: 15-20 min wait to be seated. 50 Min wait for food.  Very below average / bad food. Dry pancakes. Cold food.  Undercooked Potatoes.  Eggs were slightly runny.  Don't even look at the turkey sausage it was terrible. Waitress was nice.

hqbp9kcU1NaJM8FxVwtzRw.text: I tried again with the family tonight during Brentwood Light up Night. Service was very friendly like usual. I orderd a bleu cheese burger wihtout the bun (see pic). The beef is grass feed and very good. The bleu cheese did the trick for me with the toppings of tomato, onion and lettuce.   We also had a nice hot cup of wedding soup and it was wonderful.    I am keeping this at 3 stars for the time being, this is definetly better the the other breakfast place a few buildings down.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Bleu Cheese Burger (without bun as I requested). Very good, grass feed beef and wonderful bleu cheese.
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Side salad was crisp.
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Wedding soup. Tasted fresh and hot.

Xb0hGPohV05sZ8qu-G2Mvw.text: My wife went to this place first after a friend recommended it. She came back bringing me along for the ride, and I'm glad she did. The menu has a wide selection of breakfast and lunch items. I'd take off half a star if I could, mainly due to parking issues.  The prices are slightly higher than some breakfast places, but the quality is very high. We both ordered their Eastwood Omelet $9.99. It was a combination of cheese, onion, peppers, ham and bacon. The meats were of much higher quality than I expected. Great job! I would also recommend their cheesy potatoes. First Watch now has some serious competition for a place that specializes in breakfast. They offer limited outdoor seating,  but the interior is very homey. Service could not have been better. They have a loyalty program. We joined. Need I say more?

sjdR19_P_ZUVfl7cRByO_A.text: I've been twice, a Sunday each time. The menu is scaled down on Sundays, which is something I personally dislike. I feel Saturday and Sunday is your prime chance to pump out your best dishes, not the b class to save time.   Each time I went, I felt very rushed, despite the restaurant not appearing busy. This is very annoying to the point where you are asked if you have decided 3-4 times within two minutes of sitting down. Maybe this is a tactic to rush people before they have a chance to realize nothing amazing is on the menu.   Each time, I have ordered a coffee - each time, the cup had old coffee stains on it which is disgusting.   Onto the food: I have tried the breakfast pizza, which sounds like a light, fresh spin on breakfast. However, this dish was LOADED with olives and easily became overly salty. I actually felt a tad sick afterwards.  The second visit order was the chicken/ egg dish. You get two small chicken fingers that seemed just a tad overlooked. The marble rye toast and eggs were good enough. My main complaint with this order was with the side of "potato pancakes". They were smaller version of McDonald's hashbrowns.... Nowhere near what a potato pancake is supposed to be. They should just call them hashbrowns.   A friend ordered the cracked Arnold- they rated it mediocre.   This place could be good if the had better menus on Sundays and focused on improving their service and cleanliness.   Save yourself the disappointment and head to J. Ts diner a few doors down. They don't try to be as fancy, but they cook good meals.

3Jy7r2_LHnqRXaWnYoPYEA.text: This place is so cute and quaint, not to mention the food is delicious. I have been here numerous times with friends and family and I never have been disappointed. Everything is fresh and the service is good. The cheesy bacon pizza is delicious.

mjKYbqRru1X6msG-bWUpgQ.text: Went here today with my boyfriend and it was awful. We were 1 of 2 tables in the place and it took over half an hour to get my breakfast and his chicken tenders and when they arrived you could tell the food had been sitting in the window while our waitress was standing around talking to coworkers and concerning herself more with her clean up and side work rather than paying attention to her customers. My pancakes were cold and hardened on top from being under a heat lamp, the potatoes were obviously scooped out of a huge pan that had been sitting all day and were definitely not fresh, my toast was stale. My boyfriend was missing his coleslaw which when we finally received it was warm and his fries were only warm on the outside and still somewhat cold and frozen inside. Definitely has gone down hill since they first opened, will not be going back again.

Cz37xGfL8mcC84qyK5dN_w.text: Service was very good. Pankcakes were awesome. Omlets can use a little more work.... All ingredients look to be prepared separately and then folded at the end. Hard to eat without ingredients falling out.

LbzzNPq5SkhC926xzAeh5g.text: I have been to The Crack'd Egg a handful of times, and while the food is always delicious, the kitchen is so very slow.  We waited 60+ minutes for our food on a not-so-busy Sunday morning!  The server was very apologetic and nice, but that can only take you so far when you're waiting that long.  Unfortunately because of how slow the service is, I don't think I'll be heading back here since there are so many other equally as good breakfast spots around Pittsburgh.

3r7o-AAWKEAvh-2Jf2PzOQ.text: Stopped in this cool little cafe for a quick lunch, and was happy we did. What a great little gem right in Brentwood!  Right across from the giant eagle on Brownsville road, it's easy to get to with plenty of parking on street and around the corner. Lots of space inside with a cool set up. The menu is awesome with great breakfast items and lunch meals. We had the grilled chicken sandwich and the tomato basil soup. Soup is made fresh and it's excellent. The breakfast menu had plenty of options as well as daily specials. The day we were there they had a smores pancake that looked amazing!!! We will be back... Often

CjZxaOH9gEvV_T_8n33qTQ.text: So the only reason this place doesn't get one star is because the food and the decor is actually pretty good.   However after that it goes way down hill faster. Today was our third time here and the service continues to get worse & worse. Our server today Jules was the epitome of atrocious.   If I was dying of thirst, I would of shriveled up and died. I got one refill of water after begging for it. She never took our waters from our table to refill.   Then my wife asked for more sriracha honey sauce for her chicken & waffles, Jules never brought it. It seemed like she was avoiding us for some reason.   I'm not quite sure how this place works, but It doesn't seem like the servers have sections. Jules had tables outside, two tables right by the bar and tables in the back of the restaurant. How can a server possible be all over the restaurant and give good service.   And to recall our last visit I ordered a dish with a poached egg and it was hard inside. The server told me I was wrong and that's the way the egg was suppose to be. Well obviously she doesn't know what a poached egg is. How can you work at a bfast joint and not know what a poached eggs. The manager that day gave me 10% off my entree. Thanks for the $1.90 savings?!?!?  I really want to like this place the food is really good, but service is poor, it takes too long for the food to come out, it makes me not want to come back.   Crak'd egg thank you but no thanks

5KiRN__JFIE3P3ihP8Qe-w.text: the decor here is beautiful!!! And the service is always very kind. The reason I have to unfortunately knock it down a few stars is things are changing here fast. My dad went to pick us up lunch from here about a week ago and they told him they don't serve grilled chicken or turkey sausage anymore. The turkey sausage I can understand if it isn't popular to save money but grilled chicken? That comes in some of my favorite and what I'm assuming so of the more popular entrees (grilled chicken salad, grilled chicken sandwich) etc. they still serve chicken but only fry it now, maybe it conserve it and save money, which I understand but I can't deny it's a bit of an inconvenience to people who prefer grilled. Overall it's still delicious food, but hopefully not much else will Change.

M8TmdeK6xLKSNvj-Aor9Gg.text: For more than a month I have been eating here every Sunday. Love the food, the wait staff has been great. And then today, we.could not even get seated. There were obviously two top tables available, and when I asked about one of the right in front of us. I was told no. Two minutes later, a couple came in and they were ready to seat them at the table I have just mentioned. Why, I don't know, we left and will never go back again. Really shitty service is all I can say now. Don't go here.

RdqQGToBxNJajPqwO4AQLg.text: My favorite little breakfast spot! The wait is usually short and the service is great. Nothing tops the food- I've tried most of the menu and haven't had a thing I didn't like. 11/10 would recommend!

laezZ-hJoUi_vzlPRks3ww.text: This place is a fantastic breakfast nook! The cute place is very well decorated, and even though we didn't sit there, I thought their bar was beautiful. The place isn't very large but they have found a way to include a lot of seating without feeling like the table next to you is too close. We took our seats and the waitress came right over to ask for our drinks, I got a vanilla cold brew coffee and it was so good, dare I say better than Starbucks! I really appreciated how friendly and attentive our waitress was. I know from experience that being a waitress is a hard job. The menu had a great number of awesome sounding breakfasts. My boyfriend got the "Release the Crackin" which is basically a little bit of everything, and I got a biscuit and gravy with potato pancakes. My food was delicious, my boyfriend's meal was epic and looked freshly made. The pancakes were huge and a different texture from pancakes I've had but I really liked them! This is a great place for breakfast and it's very affordable!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

2fybS4M-CKYrJjyC0csAWA.text: Wow. Love this place! Great and comfortable atmosphere. Very pretty, warm, and inviting.  The staff is fun and friendly. The portions are large and Delicious!!   Best to bring a good appetite!!

pmoeM08NgKXTbsX-gNcvEA.text: Stopped in for a quick B-fast to meet a friend who really liked the Crack'd Egg.  Liked the service and friendliness of the staff.   The menu has some creative takes on some old standbys.  My Capri Benedict is two eggs on two thick sliced tomatoes with some Motz cheese, Hollandaise, and Balsamic Reduction and some great home fries.  Really a nice B-fast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Old Fashion Floats menu
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Capri Benedict &amp; home fries

JHpY6tgFtl5lgc_2XZe5eg.text: Food was delicious.  1st time here.  Service was grear and very attentive.  Will definitely be back

RZorD7v71TwnT7sveZW5Yg.text: Excellent breakfast spot.  Extremely clean and surprisingly spacious. The quality of the food was evident. Eggs cooked perfectly (over easy for me and scrambled for the mrs). Great meat options (bacon was the star but ham v good as well). Breadworks bread is always a plus. Strong/tasty coffee and they kept it coming. Pancakes were good but not a highlight for me. Maybe a little too fluffy if that's possible?  If anything only complaint was too much food but that's a kind of problem I like to have ("release the cracking" is an enormous meal).  Had some nice things for kids as well (balloons, water table in small outdoor area).  Really enjoyed our first visit here and will definitely be back.

JxfzI-Gu_fQiVTxYrQ1siA.text: My partner and I visited for an attempted quick bite. Don't come here if that's what you're looking for. We were here for almost 2 hours in total. My meal was mostly delicious. If you make it here, get the cheesy potatoes. The bacon was a disappointment. It was a dried husk compared to the beautiful thick cut bacon pictured in the photos.   My partner's "over medium" eggs were incredibly runny, and his pancakes were like stiff Frisbee. The nice potential of this place is the BYOB bloody marys, but we didn't think ahead to do that.

gA25JTzaTe8oyEDefKzd4w.text: The food was okay, pricey for eggs. However our server forgot to put our order in. It took almost an hour to get our breakfast. Not a 2nd timer for me.

OSZgvTix213iivqgE3E5tg.text: Just across street from my coffee latte found store, I see this. So..carrot cake looks great as I walk in. Clerk seating me says oh yes and made here in house. That i'm having now. Not amazing but pretty good. Have asked for eggs, bacon, potatoes, and a biscuit. Cool setting here with roll-up glass garage door on front facing street. Cool. Overall everything was very good and service excellent. I would absolutely return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

3p9MSE5VTsQLNU3Yhl_lHw.text: The Crack'd Egg is definitely in my top 5 favorite breakfast places in Pittsburgh. I love the atmosphere and how it is so cozy. All the servers I've had have been so nice and helpful which makes the expirevce even better! All the food was fresh and handmade which is a pleasant surprise compared to most breakfast places. I am not able to have cream as asked if she had soy or almond milk, unfortunately they didn't, but they said they would look into getting some next time and were so helpful providing me with alternative options. There specials each week are so tasty!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

9igR9XJ7o7Bi80eppradzQ.text: First time here, food was awesome, cornbeef hash was the best I've ever had, real shredded cornbeef, not canned crap. My GF had pancakes w/bacon, excellent. You can tell it's made with love. The service was great, waitress was super attentive & very friendly,  also local so we talked a lot about the area. Hands down, great breakfast/lunch spot. Can"t wait to go back & try something else.

C4pZfWsdkOTCVNdDcIbKAA.text: This is a little sweet secretin the South Hills Pittsburgh. My son saw the reviews on yelp and we went for it. So glad we did. The breakfast was the best ever. We typically just go to the food chains but now that we found this place we have changed our tune. Weekends are are to get in but weekdays are good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Best breakfast in the South Hills

sp0FNl8AMoKag2KRAXlXVA.text: I visit this place sometimes on the weekends for brunch because it is so close to home. The quality is always pretty good, prices are reasonable, great diner coffee But leave extra time if you go here because the service is quite slow, the food usually takes at least 30-40 minutes and the servers don't seem to be in any hurry either

8KGLS6y1VOW2kaOZds-yfg.text: Great breakfast place with decent prices. A lot of their menu is made in house and delicious, will defiantly return in the near future

IZTTIBLUL9NIxtnQwDNDLg.text: It's nice to see a new breakfast spot in the South Hills area of the Burgh- they were in need of one. This place is very cute and homey, with friendly and welcoming service as the icing on the cake. The food is very good- we came here for breakfast and had a wonderful meal. It's nothing that will blow you away with unique and crazy flavors, but instead it is comforting, delicious breakfast food that you are already familiar with and love.

fj5NvSZh0_dFR_ZeTyPJoQ.text: This place is cute and quaint for a relaxed Sunday breakfast. I had their Lenten special, which was a salmon eggs Benedict with a lemony hollandaise sauce, served over potato pancakes and cheesy potatoes on the side. I wish I would have substituted for a different side because it was just too much with the hollandaise (but still delicious). It's BYOB, so don't forget the necessary mimosa parts!

BSmy_mT2-Z6TFsk8HsZxiQ.text: Had a week worth of work here in the Pittsburgh area and was looking for a good breakfast place. Warm interior and a super friendly staff, Marlene in particular showed a great service. I had a corned beef hash and it was excellent. I came by two more times after that and had the same thing CBH. Most definitely come back again and would recommend this place. Also price was very reasonable.

-M7FNOW0MPoCy_rPixYXxw.text: The Crack'd Egg was more like a scrambled experience.  Once arriving, the hostess was outside having a conversation that the waitress openly admitted to us. They weren't sure what to do with us, only to eventually seat us. We waved this off as a weird fluke and tried to get on with the meal.  After getting seated, we realized that our table was a very awkward size. I was so far away from my dining partner that it was uncomfortable. Some of the seating is also on a higher level than the middle of the floor so I felt as if people were staring as me/our meal the entire time which was uncomfortable.  After ordering a tea and waiting on my deal, the chicken and the egg, a waitress spilled her tray of drinks which flung themselves far enough to also get on me more than the table at which she spilled at (higher level seating 1, me 0). I understand that mistakes happen, but at this point it just seemed like the whole staff was unsure about everything going on.  When the meals finally arrived they were okay but not great. I'm so glad that I asked for the gravy that came with my meal on the side as it was very heavy and I didn't end up using it at all. The chicken and eggs were tasty, but nothing to write home about. However, because the food was good and better than your average diner, I'm giving this place a 3 stars because of all the other awkwardness.

M4JhaHn8O0QNaK8Ld4-Nyw.text: Super cute breakfast spot. Love her choice of decor. One of our favorites when staying close to the south hills  Friendly staff!

ADaFu6buH-593jc5v0T5og.text: This is a great place for a nice breakfast. The food is always perfect. The prices are always reasonable. The service is always friendly. The atmosphere is always... well I suppose it depends on your beliefs. While at first I found the decorations very welcoming and comforting, after a few visits I realised that the walls were riddled with religious beliefs. To each their own I suppose, but the once "welcoming" decor became very unwelcoming.

PqNvEz9XgYW3aT52LL_qDg.text: Excellent food ,service ,and atmosphere as usual i have never experienced anything less than that when i go to this intimate yet roomy diner i had my usual Popeye omelet its an omelet with chorizo spinach and feta it's sooooooooooooooooo good it comes with your choice of toast and potatoes i suggest cheesy potatoes but they are all good i also got a banana  pancake  on the side and every single bite had a fresh piece of banana in it this place is worth the drive no matter what part of Pittsburgh your coming from!!!

fUN2VPa34_GhLli8EVBc0w.text: There's nothing more that I love than breakfast. Replacing an older breakfast joint, the Crack's Egg really cracked the code to a great spot. Totally renovated and open space. The coffee is strong, hot and bottomless.   I've visited twice and can't wait to go back for more. Omelettes are fluffy and full. Selections of breads to accompany and choices of potatoes makes me very happy on a Saturday AM drop-in.   While I haven't (yet) tried the waffles or pancakes, from a distance they look amazing! One of these options will definitely be my next morning fill up though it will be hard to veer from my love of omelettes.   Stop in and check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

1SxsPEL7oaw8G5giEHRBUQ.text: The reviews were good and the menu sounded delicious. Unfortunately we were duped. The breakfast burrito was unremarkable and the avocado toast Benny was very odd. One small piece of bread spread very thinly with unseasoned avocado & two poached eggs. I asked for Hollandaise sauce and had the privilege of paying extra for it! The grilled cinnamon roll was really dry so we asked for extra icing to moisten it and again had the privilege of paying extra for it! Extremely disappointing. Seems like a lot of those reviews were planted by employees or family members.

Rs9APv5GR61qguyYt_w29A.text: The food was good and reasonably priced but the portions were small in my opinion. I had the caprese benedict and it was just poached eggs on top of tomato slices. Still could have used an English muffin or something with it because there was nothing to soak up the egg and hollandaise with. My fiance had the biscuits and gravy and he liked it but again the portion was pretty small. It was not busy in there and the service was fast. Another plus is they are BYOB with whatever you want to bring for mimosas or bloodies..but unfortunately I didn't know this til we were already there. Didn't see it advertised on their website unless I missed it.

_fUbZmXPWn-z-ELMxY2OCg.text: Ordered from DoorDash and it did take awhile to get the food, but it was SO good. I hadn't heard of this place before that but I'm so glad we found it! I had a breakfast sandwich that was also a burger!!! I thought it was fantastic and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone that's a breakfast or brunch lover like myself.

DuEUrWpeF44C2iOfFInN_w.text: It's Sunday so free street parking! I wanted more than I could eat but ordered it anyway.  Everything tasted great and the waitress remembered my name and how I like my eggs. Impressive since I wouldn't call myself a regular.  Our table was too small to hold all the plates so that was a bit annoying, but we made do and enjoyed ourselves and the food nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Eggs, bacon, toast, coffee and potatoes - forget dish name. I asked to hold the potatoes. And oatmeal with raisins (out of berries.)
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Crack&#39;d Grin and a side pancake.  Great tasting smoked bacon and very, very good  tasting hot German potato salad.

YnSfCcZA-V-fEOo8uFyGpw.text: Amazing breakfast food! You get so much food for the amount you pay for. This was my first visit and I will definitely be coming back. The menu had a lot of variety so theres something on there for everyone. The only downside was that they didn't have a parking lot so we had to park at the meters and that in itself was a hassle.

So1eFxq66-9zK5Rd7Uj4Kg.text: I went here for the second time this morning with my father for brunch. We had an enjoyable experience again. We had a hard time deciding what to get because the menu had such a nice variety. I decided on the Belgium waffle and turkey sausage. The waffle was really great but I wasn't crazy about the turkey sausage. It was way too spicy for me. Our waitress was very nice too. The place is small, but adorable and well kept.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

O2YrLB-qFsVh9t69VDCMOA.text: Holy Moly Breakfast Nirvana!!! The Crack'd Egg, just Crack'd into my top 3 favorite morning eateries in Pittsburgh! I plan on becoming a regular here before the rest of the Burgh finds out about this place. It's literally perfect.   The food, the service, the upscale diner setting, I wouldn't change a thing. And on top of it all, the prices are very reasonable! Oh yeah, and it's BYOB!! Oh yeah, and it's never too busy!!!  The only reason that I'm writing this review and not trying to keep this place as my own personal secret is because I don't want to run the risk of them not succeeding.   I HATE driving down Sawmill Run Blvd from Green Tree, but for this breakfast insanity, I'm just gonna have to suck it up.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. &#39;I&#39; dare you to say this breakfast doesn&#39;t look Perfect, and only 10$!!

pjaRiFXS9vTMG00mClZPxA.text: The Crack'd Egg is a cozy and friendly neighborhood breakfast spot! As a new resident to PA I so appreciate the love for breakfast foods and all of the options Pittsburgh has to offer. I was looking for a spot where I could eat alone and would have the charm of a neighborhood spot but still accept credit cards (what can I say.. I'm a millennial and rarely have cash).   I visited on a Friday morning. It was busy but not too busy to be seated immediately. The service was quick and friendly. Surprisingly quick!! I ordered pumpkin coffee off their seasonal menu and that was great. Then I ordered chocolate chip pancakes and bacon.   This isn't your greasy diner type of place so that's why I'm excited to give it 5 stars. I'm happy to support a neighborhood gem that serves delicious breakfast food in a clean, upscale environment with friendly service and good prices.   I can't wait to go back to try the cinnamon bun!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

0znC6eyJKy1YMXrOjDva2Q.text: The Eastwood omelette was amazing! Great service and the breakfast was so filling and savory. My daughter really enjoyed the berry oatmeal as well.

JtkpKcoQ7ADyuTNxZmeeAA.text: The service was very good and it was a great place to eat. The decorations were adorable and the staff was very welcoming and our order came out quickly. The portion sizes are large and the food is great. Prices were amazing and I felt like I was at home eating there. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great breakfast or lunch anytime.

Az_VT97H-RWOOfF8eFWXIg.text: Visitors from out of town and we felt right at home here at The Crack'd Egg. The staff was AMAZING. Friendly, courteous, and WONDERFUL with kids. We had a very squirrely and hangry 2 year old and they went above and beyond to keep her entertained and happy. I think it's fantastic that they have a kids toy station for kids to go pick what they want to allow the adults a minute to get their morning caffeine pumping in their veins.  The food was outstanding. Everything that was ordered in our party of 6 was top notch and we all licked our plates clean. Notables: My husband had the TOP O' THE MORNIN' Hash and I had THE CHICKEN & THE EGG. Amazing.   We left highly recommending this place to our local family who hadn't been before, and will definitely return whenever we're in town!!

sfSlTmBfF6yRWTkHZtSeBw.text: We recently bought a business nearby and have been making early trips in, so this has become a regular spot for us. I've had the typical eggs bacon toast potato breakfast, the chicken fingers and gravy breakfast, the pecan praline pancakes...and who knows what else, but those are my faves.  Breakfast is hot! And not the kind of hot where the plates sit under heat lamps and wait for their server- but fresh hot! The service is genuinely friendly- like they really look pleasant and treat their customers like regulars. Even when we weren't at first.  I like sitting at the counter when it's my husband and I because the staff is so sweet to be around. But when they kids are with us, every table or booth is a good spot and they really treat our kids well. Oh and consistent is another word I would use. Always good food, solid service and an organized hostess. The bacon costumes help too ;)

rZACXP38J0DZ2E0ortc6AQ.text: We tried The Crack'd Egg on a whim when we only had so much time before an appointment but wanted to grab some breakfast. The inside is so much cuter than you'd expect with a staff that makes you feel like they know you from the moment you walk in. The menu has a little bit of something for everyone. I would DEFINITELY recommend the egg salad. It's the best I've ever had. Service is great, food is delicious, and prices are on spot. What else could you ask for?

DOyNHhdEjcyqxKbcUdteog.text: So glad we finally stopped here!  We both had items off of the seasonal menu- the egg roll breakfast bowl and the holiday turkey eggs benedict. SO GOOD. Great staff, lovely ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Turkey eggs benedict
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Egg roll breakfast bowl

OZXfpxrTtF1mX5hgD3dwKw.text: This was my first time I've tried this place, and it certainly won't be the last! I really enjoyed my visit today. We went for breakfast and there was plenty of parking. I imagine on the weekend, it will be really tough to find parking if it is packed. They have meter parking, and unfortunately I didn't have cash, so we planned to just keep an eye out. However, our seating did not give us the view of the street. The waitress was super sweet and gave us some quarters - just in case. I had the Eastwood omelette with crispy potato pancakes. They both were very delicious. The crispy potato pancakes were cooked perfectly! They were crunchy and very flavorful. I would be happy with just those! The omelette included peppers, onions, cheese, ham, and bacon. Every ingredient stood out but didn't over power any of the others. So with each bite I tasted everything!! This was one of the best breakfast meals I've had in awhile. Can't wait to try something else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Cute table decor

cEgvvFEf94y9eVbMNhtATg.text: I can honestly say that this is the first breakfast spot we've ever been to that had cloth napkins.  The people there were really nice and our food came to the table quickly. My wife and I both ordered a side of fruit and while it wasn't canned fruit, some of the grapes were a little rotten. My ham and cheese omelet was pretty good, but the ham was actually cold. If it would have been grilled, like the side of ham my wife ordered, it would have been better. So the food wasn't bad, and the people were friendly, but the rotten fruit, cold ham, and the fact it was actually a little on the pricey side for breakfast, I could only go 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Ham and cheese omelet.

vtqUuBOWB4XJcPR-Fe7VwA.text: Great little place with indoor and sidewalk cafe dining. Unusual selection to chose from including ghost pepper omelets.   Dog friendly (at least outside dining). Great tasting food at reasonable prices

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Storefront

SFpbd4HAU4EZY0DxlwMhCw.text: This was my first time here for breakfast.  The food was fresh, the menu names creative and the server very personable!  I knew it would be a good experience when our server just gave us four quarters for the parking meter and told us about the street behind the restaurant to park next time.   The coffee was hot and not your typical water downed breakfast java.  It was bold and delicious.  They offer three different kinds of potatoes; cheesy, home fries and crispy potato pancakes. We had the latter two and they were both full of flavor.    The toast options were more extensive than most as well.  An added bonus included in the jelly selection orange marmalade and apple butter... again outside of the norm.  I had the chicken and the egg. Two homemade chicken tenders smothered in a very yummy homemade gravy, two eggs (mine over medium for a little dippy action), home fries and two thick pieces of marble rye toast.  My daughter had the Eastwood which was a stuffed omelet with all kinds of goodness.   My only lack of five stars was the price. For two of us with tip $30 for breakfast. A bit steep. But you pay for the ambience and the quality food.  Don't worry. I will be back!  Well done!!!  UPDATE     I was here again a few times.  Since my first visit I have eliminated carbs for the most part, in my life.  I wanted an omelette but I did not care for the toast and potatoes (so many choices)!  I asked to substitute a small side salad for the potatoes and toast.....they said yes for no extra charge!!!  They have come through again.  So if you are a KETO eater ....  give em a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

8Hr01Hy9rNBjnqIFr7eIVA.text: Cute little place on Brownsville near the Giant Eagle. Street parking. Mostly indoor but few outdoor seating options. Restaurant has always been clean and servers friendly.   Good breakfast options. Gets busy on weekends during prime breakfast/brunch times as you could expect. They offer specials in addition to regular menu. I've enjoyed the avocado toast and inlets. Have not tried lunch menu.   I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Avocado toast special
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Olive oyl omelette

2cnZUqWdYWbN_uuVbtPDgg.text: Great food, great service!  Best breakfast in the 'burgh!  The servers are very friendly, and food is very fresh. Highly recommend the "Release the Cracking"--3 eggs, 2 pancakes , 2 meats, potatoes and toast

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Best breakfast in the &#39;burgh!

v4SMXAx-6-z19jph0_Ll9Q.text: My only complaint is that I didn't bring vodka for the Bloody Mary bar. Otherwise the Frappe was amazing, the cracked loaded fries were to die for (gravy, bacon, and cheese on top of fresh fries) and their chicken and waffle was the best combination of sweet and salty. I wanted to try probably 7 more things in the menu but there's not enough room on this belly for that. I would def go back if I'm in town again and bring my vodka.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Loaded cracked fries
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Greeting sign
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Frappe

4Me80L5UDeaJ-z45e3cs5A.text: This is our new go-to for breakfast and brunch!! You absolutely cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. I love getting takeout, but the restaurant is pretty cool for dining in too.   My favorite is probably the chicken and the egg, which has chicken tenders, gravy, eggs, potato and toast. Their gravy is so good! If the chicken and the egg sounds like too much, you've got to try the gravy and get the biscuits and gravy.   We order takeout here probably every weekend. Food is prepared fast, it's good, and very affordable!

3ZGJT-MbFizdW9OFmbEMhg.text: I so enjoyed the Cracked egg! I came here this past Sunday for breakfast while out and about the South hills area. Small diner with a cozy feel and awesome comfort food. I got the chicken or the egg breakfast with 2 chicken tenders with gravy, eggs over easy, toast and the best home fries I ever did have! ... so satisfying.  I saw that they have a BYOB Bloody Mary situation on Saturdays and Sundays. The only time I wish I had a spare bottle of Tito's on me!!!!! Will be embarking on this at a later date ;)

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

wf5zDxRUgRMAQCFuTfRv3A.text: I really loved the atmosphere of this restaurant. It's so cute on the inside and the country theme makes it feel home-y. The neighborhood behind the restaurants has 2 hour free parking on the street. We only waited about 5 min for a table during Sunday brunch time. It was really hard to decide because there were so many good things in the menu. I finally settled on the the chorizo omelet with breakfast potatoes and wheat toast. The omelet was great, especially the feta, and the chorizo had just enough spice. It was a big omelet but I finished the whole thing. The breakfast potatoes were the best, with lots of seasoning and crispy edges. My boyfriend got the biscuits and gravy and loved it. I dipped my Toast in the gravy and it was really good. I think this place will be a frequent brunch spot until I try everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Biscuits and gravy and thick cut Bacon
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Walking turkey balloon lol
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Chorizo omelet

GuyDVlY_yF903C0b5W3ulw.text: This place seems to be Brentwoods best kept secret. I have seen the front of this place almost everyday driving down Brownsville rd but never had the opportunity to go in because of their hours of operation (8am-2pm).  Looking at the front, you would think this is a small breakfast diner with maybe a dozen tables. This place is deceptively large! It has a country kitchen feel to the decor and a nice laid back staff.  They serve mostly breakfast food but also offer a lunch menu. They also have multiple options to pick from. Sausage, bacon, corned beef, home fries, potato patty, wheat toast, white toast, rye toast, multiple syrups, etc. This is just naming a few!  The service was great, the food was great, and the overall feel of the place was great.   5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

mXWUPOQ6jtCKN0I76d8b_w.text: When you arrive it feels like a diner in Florida - yellow walls decorated with colorful wall art and a gray chair rail.  The tapestry bar stools are a warm feeling also.    The staff will happily seat you to a booth or table if you do not wish to sit at the bar.   Then it is  time to make decisions on what to eat.  My husband got the Release the Cracken...You get to decide your egg style, 2 (two) meat selections, potato type, toast type and then you get to select pancakes - plain, blueberry, banana or chocolate chip.  Everything came out perfect. It is March so I chose the Cracked Ruben which came with awesome potato pancakes.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  We definitely have a new South Hills favorite breakfast stop.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Release the Cracken and Cracked Rueben

a2u8FYjiQTpX4VAYNZfs1A.text: I had herd about the Crack'd Egg and many raving reviews. My daughter and I went there for breakfast today. Th waitress came over and gave us menus and took drink orders immediately. Waitress was extremely friendly. I had 2 eggs over easy with well done bacon and home fries and white toast. The bacon was the best part of the meal unfortunately. The home fries were very good as well, But it was like a half a portion??? The eggs which should of been over easy where not cooked correctly not left on 2nd side long enough to cook it correctly. the yolk was fine but the whites were watery? / whites not cooked properly. If it was not for the fantastic and friendly service I would of given them 1-2 stars only. I give them 3 stars as the service was exceptional, But the food not. I do not think I would go there again as I generally eat the same thing all the time and to get half an order of home fries and eggs that are not cooked correctly I do not need to travel that distance. The place is very nice and very cozy. And as I stated the waitress was super friendly and nice. Unfortunately I can not recommend the Crack'd Egg.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

oJIuy8FOmlO_u2Meb2FrIQ.text: Great breakfast joint, beat corned beef hash I've ever had. Friendly staff, loved it.

4OEVchzjCP9iK-8BZw3V9g.text: Not a big breakfast person and anytime anyone asks me to go to breakfast with them I always hope it's late in the morning so there's a chance I can order lunch food without being judged. So I was pleasantly surprised and very impressed with the menu as there were many unique options. Everything sounded so good and I had the hardest time making my decision. I ended up getting the Olive Oyl omelette that had Feta Cheese, Spinach, Tomato, Red Onion & Kalamata Olives. No lie, it was the best omelette I've ever had in my life. Every bite was so flavorful and they were certainly not skimpy with any of the ingredients. It was such a beautiful day outside when we went and wanted to soak up every minute we could of the weather so decided to sit outside. Honestly though we were kinda bummed we didn't get the experience of sitting inside because it was so adorable. It has this country-ish vibe with a garage door that opens up. It's okay though, just means we'll have to come back again real soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

Fk9H2c9rHO_lN-i5yrUGiQ.text: We went here on a recommendation.  The food was awesome.  The place is bigger than it looks too.  You can sit outside or inside.  Service was wonderful and quick.  We will be visiting again, again, and again.

AJn0DFYCZcHc_VzoWouPnw.text: When to the cracked egg and really felt like I was hit over he head with so much msg! Omg - people can we please find a breakfast joint that at least used real eggs????

yaDdkLrIEZPKybznXXjYIg.text: This place is absolutely adorable!! Every inch has been decorated to perfection. There is a cute little vinyl cut outs of mice in the hallway by the bathroom. The tables have little tins for garbage, it is very well thought out. I had very high hopes!!  Sadly, hope this was a fluke,  our food was not as good as I hoped.  I had the eggs, bacon, cheesy potatoes, pancake and toast.  The eggs were under cooked, the bacon was SALTY!, the pancake had NO flavor, and the toast which is so good- I think was over kill. 4 slices of giant toast was too much.  No jelly was provided either.  The cheesy potatoes are scalloped potatoes they were very good! My husband ordered the omelette with peppers and ham. The peppers and onions weren't sauteed at all, the ham was fatty.  The potato pancakes were warmed up from a box.   Again way too much toast.  The place is adorable but the food was not as good as I hoped it would be.  I would give it a second chance,  but I'm not rushing back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Adorable seating area
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Garage doors to bring the inside out and vice versa
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. CUTE decor!!! Every detail is thoughtfully executed.

OPFZmijDlaTfWJPueJBknw.text: Amazing! Food and service is awesome! The decor and atmosphere is adorable! One of my favorite breakfast /brunch places.

7EPZErEsvY_isreFyFxeHQ.text: I stopped over here after my blood work "fast" to try out their breakfast. They actually serve lunch and brunch but I opted for breakfast. The place is very clean and there are tables and booths along with a bar to eat from.  Upon arrival I was told I could sit anywhere I wanted. I chose a large booth and my waitress was extremely attentive to my needs. I even had a cloth napkin which held my silverware. Portion sizes appeared huge but I had a craving for an omelette. If one on the list didn't meet your expectations then you can order a "make your own" with one meat and 3 other fillings. The omelet comes with toast of your choice, and your choice of home fries or potato pancakes.  Most omelets are 3 eggs so I ordered one with Swiss cheese and veggies. Everything you need is right on the table including ketchup. I got my food in a reasonable amount of time.  This omelet was delicious and the rye bread that came with it was very thick! Quite filling to say the least. I had coffee-your standard type you would get in most breakfast spots but I liked the fact that the food was not greasy and believe me hard to finish. Prices are very reasonable for what you are getting. This is a very small place on Brownsville Road almost directly opposite Brentwood Towne Square. Parking however, can pose a problem. Street parking is available if you are lucky enough to find it. You cannot park in the Towne Square and walk up. Signs are there stating they will tow unless you are visiting one of those businesses.   Definitely a must return to try out for lunch. 2 hour street parking is available during the day but again the spots are very limited.

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Your way omelette with home fries and toast
Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States

0l7Z0EiG-DeJf3Vj0aP1Mw.text: The cutest little breakfast place around! The inside is surprisingly spacious for the area. There is a cute little outdoor patio as well. Not only was the restaurant nice, but the food... oh my god. It was a little pricey for a breakfast, but you got more than your money's worth. I had the banana pecan French toast, and wow, I have never had anything like it. If you can get the pecan praline syrup on a meal, absolutely do it. It is incredible. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Crack'd Egg - Brentwood, PA, United States. Banana Pecan Pancakes - Amazing

4tN1uRmjebJrGPsnn9EyeQ.text: Overall, a solid breakfast choice and we will be back.   We stopped by on a Saturday morning and were told to sit anywhere.  I chose a table in the front near the open garage door - very comfy with a nice cafe feel.     Both of our breakfasts were plentiful and tasty (skip the biscuit and gray though - the gravy was sub-par).   Staff members were friendly even with the chaos that a table on the patio was creating with their two dogs.   The chaos was actually quite entertaining and the people creating it were really good-natured, so it wasn't unwelcome or annoying.   You can BYOB to make bloody marys and Irish coffee and such.     Prices were reasonable, but don't forget to pay the meter....one $15 ticket later.

M_kBv4YTh2Pyw-H0f-56qw.text: This morning was my 4th visit to this restaurant and unfortunately my last. I really wanted to like it because it is local-I live very close-and independently owned. Never have had a great experience food wise and lately it seems on the dirty side. I ordered the grin-eggs over medium, toast, and bacon. It wasn't busy in the dining room and I specifically told the young man who was my waiter I like my bacon crisp and do not want any uncooked white on my over medium/hard eggs. When my order came it was without my toast-he said it was in the toaster. I had to flag him down 5 min later to ask for my toast. He went into the kitchen which was also not busy-the door was open because of the nice day and I could see him grab my toast without washing his hands-he disappeared somewhere to butter it/ brought it to my table-never apologized or stopped back to see if I wanted jelly(not on the table). This same young man went on to handle menus/money and whatever I don't care to think about. AND my egg whites were runny and bacon so gummy I couldn't eat it. I am picky about cleanliness and also a nurse so know not washing hands before handling food can lead to illness. The owners need to educate food staff on importance of hand washing to protect the public.

K1dGngb4ghs4PCCaLUgYJQ.text: I was hesitant to try this place with my pap since we are both some what picky eaters and didn't know what kind of items to expect.  We both enjoyed it.  It was a cute place with nice waitresses.  I got a croissant sandwich that was really good.  The croissant was nice and flaky and I got potato pancakes as my side and they were good.  The waitress asked if I wanted sour cream or applesauce with them and I said sour cream but I didn't get it.  I could have asked her for it but after trying them I decided that I didn't need it and ate them happily plain. My grandpa got an open face sandwich and he enjoyed it but it came out cold so he asked for it to be heated up.  He was fine with it just being put in the microwave but they recooked it.  They didn't say that but it took a long time for it to come back, I was practically finished when it came back, and I noticed that the two bites he took weren't there so I concluded that it was a whole new plate.  I also kept seeing complaints about the prices being to high but to me the prices were average for the items being locally sourced.

WrDySTeGCoQYW4HZnmCVpQ.text: A hidden gem in the South Hills!!! Food was delicious, service was great and atmosphere charming!!!!  We will be back!

tv2r_T60YdiBinI2rvOrQQ.text: Food was awesome, was waited on kid with a beard not sure of name, and I can't even describe how horrible my experience was. He had a horrible attitude throughout the whole time we were there. Almost like we weren't welcome to give them business, funny how you can pay people to be rude to you. Will never go back again and will make sure I tell everyone about this place so no one has to deal with this experience as I had to. Feel bad for the owners who get the stiff end of the stick because of crappy employees.

UIpUpFSSOsICloTwAYom9A.text: We were greeted by a very gracious host. Upon being seated our server came over to take our drink order from us. after the drinks were served we ordered our meals. A short time later our breakfast dishes were brought to our table. My wife and I were very impressed with the presentation of the food and the amount that was on our plates. are eggs bacon and potatoes were cooked to perfection. I recommend this place to anybody that's in the neighborhood.

0UvBHlt2-TApYhnA4hHPOQ.text: This is such a great little place for breakfast or lunch or even brunch. Great food, staff, friendly warm environment.

tWbCsfpKULickZf6XVVQgw.text: O.K. After about a half dozen visits since it opened, we tried very hard to like this place, but they are not cooperating.  It's been a few months since we have been back, mostly because we've been underwhelmed.  (See my post dated 11/19/2015)  Today was not a shining example of what they could, or should be.  Previous visits required a wait to be seated, which, to me, was an indication they are busy because they are good.  Arriving shortly before noon on Monday, there was no waiting.  I noticed that only one other table was occupied...not a good sign, especially at the beginning of the lunch rush.  Before I go further, I must state that I owned my own restaurant and have worked in several places as a cook, so I am familiar with what goes on.  We'll start with my order: the Crack'd Royale with Cheese.  A hash brown patty (a la McD), a bacon cheeseburger and a sunny-side-up egg, all on a toasted English muffin.  This is accompanied by a scoop of cheesy potatoes.  It was good and presented nicely.  My wife ordered Biscuits and Sausage Gravy.  This is where it got a bit strange.  About a minute after ordering, the served came over and stated "we're out of sausage for the sausage gravy.  The order doesn't come in until tomorrow."  Disappointed, my wife settled for a BLT.    While waiting for our order, we overheard a customer ordering sausage and eggs.  The customer was not told they were out of sausage.  We asked our server if they had sausage patties or links for breakfast orders.  She said "yes we do".  We then asked how they could be out of sausage for the sausage gravy.  Her response..."the cook is very particular and the recipe calls for a different sausage than what they serve with eggs".   I don't care what you say, that was a goofy answer.  There are only 5 ingredients in sausage gravy...Sausage, salt, pepper, flour, milk...If you have sausage in the restaurant, then you have sausage for the gravy!  Not having simple menu items is a sign of problems...either cash flow, the kitchen didn't to do the work, or ordering errors...any way you look at it, a problem.  With coffee and an iced tea, the bill totaled more than $23.00.  A price I don't mind paying for lunch when the place is nice (it is), the service is outstanding (it wasn't), the food is outstanding (it was very good, but not outstanding), and the menu items are available.  The final clue re-enforcing my sense of trouble, came as we observed the restaurant.    During the entire lunch hour (we left shortly before 1:00 p.m.) more than half of the tables were unoccupied.  This is not a good sign.  Like I said, we tried, but unless we hear that something has changed dramatically, we'll be elsewhere.

ClsVuop8lHvvpAKarJywYQ.text: I was so excited to try this place out. I love a good breakfast, and the menu sounded great. Talk about being underwhelmed... The food was so blah. My potato pancakes looked like something you'd buy in the freezer section at Wal Mart, and they were clearly left in the deep fryer too long. The gravy was gelatinous. My partner's pancakes were uncooked in the middle. All this said, I continue to hear good things about the place. So I'm willing to give it another try. Just not yet...

DVbzb-L8W7u5S62ZvSp0Jw.text: Called on a Sunday to place a to go order, but they said what we wanted wasn't available. Hung up to decide what we wanted, called back to order, only to find out they have a "limited" Sunday menu. The Sunday menu isn't online and they could "call me back to take my order". Needless to say, we didn't want to wait and ordered from Eat N Park.

INkOLMyW4QkIVkRHBvo0nA.text: Great food and a lovely ambiance.  Friendly servers who were very attentive.  I was really impressed by the menu- who knew there were so many great breakfast options? I will definitely be going back!

3DA7Hok8KmqjQZNw3pBBMw.text: Great independent diner serving breakfast all day. I went on a Friday mid-day and it was quiet, but service was good. Basically, everything we tried was great - eggs over medium, bacon, corned beef, turkey sausage patties, pancakes, potato pancakes (though these would be more aptly described as hashbrown coins or something). It's a bit of trek from Pittsburgh proper, but I think it'd be worth making the trip again on a day when we're in the mood for brunch and a drive.

vu4j8Af0YDKFq58UxTehSQ.text: Been here a few times, but today WOW, what AWSOME servce from ?? Marlene?? Anyways, food was good as always, just not sure why they serve the sweet sausage crumbled, still not bad tho. But if you go, hope you get this new girl, she's a great server & always attentive to your needs

fMr07S8TNqRgr1eGzFuUtQ.text: So glad this restaurant has moved into our neighborhood.  We don't have to go far for a great breakfast.  The best (BEST!) cheesy potatoes I have ever eaten.  Cozy place to have breakfast or lunch with decent menu options at reasonable prices.   Give this place a try.  You will not be disappointed.

vRpOeRaU_xIM2PoZkJAGuQ.text: Was on our way for breakfast and was stopped at light and changed plans when saw the sign. And glad we did. We will definitely be back. Food and customer service you don't find at many restaurants any more.

pmGKJabfwX7WpTC1J8AkSw.text: We are so happy to have this little place close to us! We've been here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and have always been wowed. Sometimes you don't expect diner-like places to have anything really outstanding but this joint changes that! Before I got pregnant the eggs Benedict were my favorite. Even the oatmeal is good! Husband loves the chicken and waffles. I don't think they're doing dinner right now but if they bring it back you need to try the meatloaf and mashed potatoes. Better than home-cooked. I really hope this place sticks around because next to Frank and Shirley's it's our go-to for breakfast.

T0Sxu4qbIP-p4yU4ngdgIw.text: The food was not great last week. My eggs were not made right again. If you cant make poached eggs, you shouldnt have it on uour menu.

uc1fs4qEOMYUFRsISzRVBw.text: We have gone to this restaurant for dinner and loved it.  I contacted them about a surprise party for my mom for her 75th Birthday.  They do private parties!!!  We had my mom's party today and was not disappointed!!! I cannot thank Kim, Don, Premo, Cody,Amy and Chef Mike for such a spectacular day for my mom!  They made it all about herm. It felt like we were at home with our friends and family!  The food was spectacular!!!!  I know as after today they will have new customers.  It is Brentwoods little secret, but not for long!  If you want a new place to try go here!  If you have a special occasion to celebrate like a birthday, communion, confirmation, graduation or Anniversary, please call Kim.  I promise you won't be disappointed!!!  Can't wait for our Valentines day,  Dinner, menu is awesome!!!!

NbmVs3QxZt3cqtb27Jm_dQ.text: The food was excellent, French toast, pancakes, waffles, eggs, potatoes, even the coffee was delicious.  Definitely give this place a try...

XmkatsS3qtxAlc_BqUSsng.text: Went on a Sunday morning. The decor looks great and the staff was super friendly. Was impressed with the extensive menu. The portions were generous and served promptly. We got the blueberry pancakes, poached eggs, turkey sausage, bacon wheat toast and hash browns. Everything was amazing and tasted great. I only gave 4 stars because I like my turkey sausage to be links and I thought the blueberry pancakes could have had a few more blueberries but those are just personal preferences. We willl certainly be back. Go....you will not be disappointed!

PG5nkSYeMRv9KdB4ge8sAw.text: Food was interesting and delicious. Service was quick and waitress was on point.

Y__-PwLUTRztOZ_K3jWUlQ.text: Great breakfast place! I ordered the Greek omelet delish!! Service was good looking forward to sitting outside love that they put large glass doors on so it can be opened to cafe style seating during nice weather. Great place

piMfLDZUOWq4U4TlAziCYA.text: Went for breakfast this morning had a wait to get seated, once seated we waited for 30 min no service.  Think our server was Tammy because she finally asked if we had been helped, then said give her a min.  We ended up walking out.  Food looked great and a few of the servers appeared to be great.
